dt: {bc}flowers picked and fastened together in a bunch {bc}{sx|nosegay||}
{bc}a distinctive and characteristic fragrance (as of wine)
{bc}a subtle aroma or quality (as of an artistic performance)

et: borrowed from French, going back to Middle French {it}boucquet{/it} "grove, thicket, bunch of flowers," going back to Old French (Norman & Picard) {it}bosquet{/it} "thicket," from Old French {it}bos, bois, bosc{/it} "grove, forest, wood (the material)" + {it}-et{/it} {et_link|-et:1|-et:1} {ma}{mat|boiserie|boiserie}{/ma}
shortdef: flowers picked and fastened together in a bunch : nosegay

dt: {bc}an herb mixture that is either tied together or enclosed in a porous container and is cooked with a dish but removed before serving

shortdef: an herb mixture that is either tied together or enclosed in a porous container and is cooked with a dish but removed before serving

dt: {bc}a card notifying the recipient of a number of devotional acts performed by a Roman Catholic on behalf of a person on special occasions (such as name days or anniversaries) or for the soul of someone recently deceased especially as an expression of sympathy

shortdef: a card notifying the recipient of a number of devotional acts performed by a Roman Catholic on behalf of a person on special occasions (such as name days or anniversaries) or for the soul of someone recently deceased especially as an expression of sympathy
